title: Volunteers Piece Together a Makeshift Medical System in Earthquake Zone
description: In place of damaged or destroyed hospitals, a series of field clinics have sprung up in Turkey, with doctors and nurses from around the world.

title: Where Even the Food Is Magic: A Treasure Hunt for the Flavors of Caribbean Colombia
description: In a region Gabriel García Márquez once called home, a garlic-and-coconut-infused journey guided by the culinary expertise of another local celebrity, the acclaimed chef Leonor Espinosa.

title: Biden Plans to Visit Poland for One-year Anniversary of Ukraine War
description: The president will be in the region for three days, but the White House did not say if he would make a trip into Ukraine.

title: Brazil Says it Won’t Send Weapons to Ukraine Despite Push from U.S.
description: Ahead of a meeting with President Biden at the White House, the Brazilian leader, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, said he’s interested in helping negotiate a path to peace.

title: Biden Orders U.S. to Down High-Altitude Object Over Alaska
description: The incident comes less than a week after U.S. fighter jet shot down a Chinese spy balloon over the Atlantic.

title: What Statistics Can’t Capture About the Global Baby Bust
description: Falling fertility has been hard to reverse, despite so many governments’ best efforts, because it’s not one thing, it’s everything.

title: What We Know About the Earthquake in Turkey and Syria
description: As the death toll rises in the one of the deadliest quakes in decades, a global humanitarian aid effort faces deep challenges.

title: Amsterdam Bans Marijuana Smoking on Streets of Red-Light District
description: The new regulations, which will take effect in mid-May, were introduced in response to complaints from residents about disruptive tourists.

title: Ronald S. Lauder Reaches Agreement on Klimt Painting With Jewish Heirs
description: Under the agreement, Mr. Lauder restituted the painting and then repurchased it from the relatives of an art collector who fled Europe in 1941 to avoid Nazi persecution.

title: Brazil’s Lula to Meet Biden at the White House
description: President Biden hosts Brazil’s new president on Friday in a refresh of the countries’ relations. The two leaders agree on the Amazon but are split on Ukraine.

title: Prime Minister of Moldova Resigns
description: Natalia Gavrilita had been prime minister since 2021, when she took charge of the government after elections gave a strong majority in Parliament to pro-Western politicians.

title: Putin Used Secret Decree to Pardon Ex-Inmate Who Joined War Effort, Document Shows
description: A copy of a prison release certificate reviewed by The New York Times offers evidence of what activists say is a mass pardon campaign to entice tens of thousands of inmates to enter battle.

title: At Least 2 Dead as Driver Rams Bus Stop in East Jerusalem
description: A man drove a car into a group of civilians outside an Israeli settlement in what the police described as a terrorist attack. A 6-year-old was among those killed.

title: E.U. Lawmaker Arrested in Qatar-Linked Corruption Inquiry
description: The detention of Marc Tarabella, who lost his immunity last week, is part of a long-running investigation into whether there were efforts to influence the European Parliament.

title: Russia Strikes Cities as It Ramps Up Winter Offensive
description: Ukraine’s Air Force said Russia launched a “massive” attack targeting the country’s already battered infrastructure, using drones and dozens of cruise missiles.

title: Romania Says Russian Missile Did Not Enter Its Airspace
description: Ukraine’s top military commander had earlier said that two Russian missiles crossed into the airspace of Moldova and Romania before entering Ukraine

title: Did He Say ‘Bird?’
description: We talk with Sam Altman, the C.E.O. of OpenAI, about the artificial-intelligence craze.

title: China, Still Trying to Play Down Balloon, Finds It’s Getting Harder to Do
description: Beijing has accused the United States of waging “information and public opinion warfare.” But analysts say a lack of credible messaging from China is not helping.

title: The Australians in the Super Bowl
description: How Jordan Mailata and Arryn Siposs made it to the N.F.L.

title: Turkey Quake: U.N. Aid Chief to Visit Affected Areas
description: Martin Griffiths, the United Nations humanitarian chief, said he was on his way to visit parts of Turkey and Syria affected by an earthquake that has killed more than 20,000 people.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: A Turkish city lost in the earthquake.

title: Life as the Mayor of Kherson: No Sleep. Lots of Shelling. And Some Cognac.
description: Being the leader of Kherson may feel more like a curse than an honor. But one woman isn’t giving up, even though the Russians are sitting just across the river and shelling her city nearly every hour.

title: With So Many Dead in Turkey, Families Forced to Rush Funeral Rites
description: The earthquake that hit in southern Turkey has killed more than 17,500 people there, overwhelming the traditional funeral process and accelerating how families say goodbye.

title: ‘This is Our Fate’: A Syrian Family is Displaced in Southern Turkey
description: Syrian refugees displaced by the earthquake in southern Turkey say they need water and more tents to keep their children warm.

title: ‘No More Antakya’: Turks Say the City, and a Civilization, Was Wiped Out
description: Amid scenes of utter devastation and widespread suffering in the bitter cold, residents mourned the loss of family, friends and memories.

title: In Speech to E.U. Leaders, Zelensky Links Europe to Ukraine’s Fate
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky, in only his second trip outside Ukraine since the conflict began, told European lawmakers that his country’s war against Russia was a defense of all Europe.
